abstract: United Church of Christ delegates vote 508 to 124 at church's general synod in Cleveland in favor of divestment and boycott of companies that profit from Israeli occupation and control of Palestinian territories; church is one largest Protestant denominations in United States, with around million members; majority of delegates also votes to call Israeli actions against Palestinians apartheid; Israel criticizes decision.
lead_paragraph: The church, a mainline Protestant denomination with about one million members, was one of three voting this week on divestment measures over Israel’s occupation of Palestinian territories.

headline.main: United Church of Christ Approves Divestment to Aid Palestinians
headline.print_headline: United Church of Christ Votes to Divest From Israel Over Control of Palestinian Territories

snippet: The church, a mainline Protestant denomination with about one million members, was one of three voting this week on divestment measures over Israel’s occupation of Palestinian territories.
